project_description: A simple Flutter app that toggles between displaying a Cat and a Dog when the text is clicked.
architecture_overview: This Flutter project uses the Cubit pattern for state management. The app is highly modularized with separate folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets. The state is managed by a Cubit and flows through the app efficiently.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: opens the app
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: listens to state
HomeScreen -> AnimalText: displays current animal
User -> AnimalText: clicks text
AnimalText -> AnimalCubit: toggles state
AnimalCubit -> HomeScreen: updates state
HomeScreen -> AnimalText: displays new animal
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The AnimalCubit handles the state of the animal being displayed. When the user clicks on the AnimalText widget, the toggleAnimal method of the AnimalCubit is called, which toggles the state between Cat and Dog. The HomeScreen widget listens to the state changes and updates the AnimalText widget accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (HomeScreen) which displays the AnimalText widget. The HomeScreen widget is the main entry point and manages the state updates by listening to the AnimalCubit.
